sanskrit_verse:
अग्न्यभावे तु विप्रस्य पाणावेवोपपादयेत् ।
यो ह्यग्निः स द्विजो विप्रैर्मन्त्रदर्शिभिरुच्यते ॥ ३.२१२॥
transliteration:
agnyabhāve tu viprasya pāṇāvevopapādayet |
yo hyagniḥ sa dvijo viprairmantradarśibhirucyate || 3.212||
sph_interpretive_translation: In the absence of fire, the hands of a Brahmin shall serve as the sacrificial altar; for the fire itself is declared to be the twice-born, as proclaimed by the seer-knowers of mantra.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from consciousness, not material form
Causation aligns with the presence of sacred intent, not physical elements
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by inner realization, not external conditions
Restoration logic operates through substitution of essence-preserving equivalencies
executable_legal_axioms: IF (sacred_fire_absent == TRUE) AND (agent_is_brahmin == TRUE) THEN substitute_hands_as_sacred_altar = TRUE
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters concerning ritual validity or spiritual authority, the Supreme Court must recognize that ontological equivalence—established through conscious realization—overrides physical absence. The court must affirm capacity rooted in Vedic cognition over empirical limitations.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established through mantra-seers' recognition, not sensory perception. Anupūrvaśaḥ confirms that where Agni's essence is cognized within the Brahmin, its functional equivalence manifests. Responsibility lies in maintaining alignment with that cognition. No punitive consequence arises from elemental absence when consciousness preserves dharma-sattva.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Realign agent with internal Agni through guided meditation until self-recognition occurs
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Brahmin must affirm identity with Agni before peers until stabilized
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Daily practice of Gayatri Japa to restore vibrational parity with fire-tattva
Integrity Reintegration Sequence: Community acknowledgment of realized status until collective resonance achieved
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Fire is consciousness, and consciousness is Brahman. There is no absence where realization abides. Dharma is restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
